content.text: Find the value of the constant c, if the divisor is a factor of the dividend.

hint.text:
Use the long division method to find the remainder and then equate that remainder to zero to find the value of c. For example:
\(\frac{x^3 - 2x^2 + 3x + c}{x+1}\)
has a quotient of \(x^2 – 3x + 6\) and a remainder of \(c-6\) (See image below). Equating the remainder to zero gives us a value of c = 6.
